displayName.text: Girls Prep Lower East Side Middle Charter School

formattedAddress: 420 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 420 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: This school is not the best, I'll rate it a three because the community here is attempting to be comforting, but it really isn't the best. I am a student at this school and after being involved with public prep since kindergarten recommend not to put your precious daughter in this school because this school will change your daughter's mind. In many good ways but one very bad way. This school may teach very advanced curriculum but the students in the school somehow know some very inappropriate things, that I will not list. Although this school says that it has a community for you to feel welcome at sometimes I feel no where near welcome because of the disrespect that I get from my fellow "sisters" and the teachers.

originalText.text: I love my school ! The curriculum here is definitely challenging but teachers do their best to help students understand. If you don't understand the material being taught , there are choices to stay after hours or during lunch to help. I've grew so much academically being at this school. But there are some things I don't really like about the school. Of course rules are important but I feel that they're a bit too extreme. Like the healthy food policy , we aren't allowed to eat chips nor candy at school and we're limited to beverages such as 100% juice, water and milk. I just feel like they should be a little more flexible with that rule. Another thing would be that the kids there are just .... dramatic. They cause drama upon themselves and others. I've been stuck in the middle that drama and it's really not a great time.

originalText.text:
I'm currently a GPMS parent and my niece graduated from girls prep 4 years ago and has now applied and been accepted to the University of Utah and Hunter College.  This could not have been possible had she not attended Girls Prep and received the structure and support to succeed.

My daughter will now be graduating from girls prep Middle school and I have received a tremendous amount of support with the high school application process and has received great support in her Middle school career.

I have my granddaughters in the school as well and can't imagine any other place where I would like them to be.

I Love GPMS

originalText.text: If you are looking for a middle school with an administration amenable to your concerns and your child's academic career, then consider Girls Prep LES Middle School. Girls Prep has a STEM based focus that not only challenges but will interest your child in safe environment with innovative programming and partnerships, all while promoting the core values of merit, scholarship, sisterhood, and responsibility. As a parent whose child has been enrolled since kindergarten, I have found the administration and faculty to be willing to listen to my concerns and achieve a compromise which benefits all parties, but most importantly- the student. Girls Prep now offers regents coursework for 8th graders in math and science. This gives scholars a competitive advantage- preparing and allowing them to earn admission to the city's most selective public, private, and independent high schools. But the school cannot do it alone. Girls Prep has expectations for its students where accountability is key. Much like college, teachers have office hours several times a week where students can get clarification on a topic or support if they are not performing well. Girls Prep lives up to its mission of preparing girls for college and beyond. So why only 4 stars? I want to leave room for everything that "works" for Girls Prep to continue, and then get even better.

originalText.text: This is a decent school. And I will tell you why... I came to this school in 6th grade, I only had known the English language for about 2 years, I worked really hard in all my classes even though it was challenging some teachers helped me while some didn’t. During 7th grade I was diagnosed with migraines I had to missed school a lot but I still managed to get straight A’s. This school really doesn’t care if you try or get good grades. I worked extremely hard and finished 8th grade with an average grade of 92, but the teacher didn’t award me with anything in the ceremony and I know I deserve it, they seriously only care if you  are their pets. Also the kids here are extremely rude and mean. Please do not I repeat do not send your precious daughter to this awful place.
